Package socialmedia

Class Account

java.lang.Object
socialmedia.Account
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Account extends Object implements Serializable
Represents an account on the platform.
See Also:

    validateHandle(String handle, ArrayList<Account> accountList)
    Validates a string to be used as the handle of an account by checking that it is less than 30 characters, not empty, contains no white space and is not being used by any other account in the system.

  • Constructor Details

    • Account

      public Account(String handle)
      Creates an instance of an Account object and calls the overloaded constructor with the handle and an empty description.
      Parameters:
      handle - The handle of the account to be created.

    • Account

      public Account(String handle, String description)
      Creates an instance of an account object by assigning the handle and description to the respective parameters. Also, the accountID is assigned to the next sequential ID.
      Parameters:
      handle - The handle to be associated with the account.
      description - The description to be associated with the account.

  • Method Details

    • getHandle

      public String getHandle()
      Returns the handle associated with the account.
      Returns:
      The handle of the account.

    • getDescription

      public String getDescription()
      Returns the decscription associated with the account.
      Returns:
      The description of the account.

    • getID

      public int getID()
      Returns the ID associated with the account.
      Returns:
      The ID related with the account.

    • getOriginalPostCount

      public int getOriginalPostCount()
      Returns the number of original posts (excluding comments and endorsements) the account has made.
      Returns:
      The number of original posts on the account.

    • getEndorsementCount

      public int getEndorsementCount()
      Returns the number of endorsements for posts that are made for the account.
      Returns:
      The total number of posts that are endorsing the posts made by the account.

    • getTotalPostCount

      public int getTotalPostCount()
      Returns the number of posts made by the account. This includes original posts, comments and endorsements
      Returns:
      The number of posts made by the account.

    • getPosts

      public ArrayList<Post> getPosts()
      Returns the ArrayList accountPosts which contains all of the posts created by the account. This includes original posts, comments and endorsements.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of posts created by the account

    • getNextId

      public static int getNextId()
      Returns the next sequential ID that will be assigned to the next account to be created
      Returns:
      ID to be used by the next account to be created

    • setNextId

      public static void setNextId(int id)
      Sets the next sequential ID, that will be assinged to the next account to be created, to the value passed in
      Parameters:
      id - The value to assign to nextID

    • setHandle

      public void setHandle(String newHandle)
      Sets the handle of the account to a new value.
      Parameters:
      newHandle - The value to change the handle of the account to.

    • setDescription

      public void setDescription(String newDescription)
      Sets the description of the account to a new value.
      Parameters:
      newDescription - The value to change the description of the account to.

    • resetIdCount

      public static void resetIdCount()
      Resets the sequential ID to a value of 1.

    • setEndorsementCountUpToDateToFalse

      public void setEndorsementCountUpToDateToFalse()
      Set the endorsementCountUpToDate attribute to false, so when the getEndorsementCount() method is called the number of endorsements related to the account is recalculated.

    • setPostCountUpToDateToFalse

      public void setPostCountUpToDateToFalse()
      Sets the boolean value of postCountUpToDate to false. postCountUpToDate states whether the count of original posts is up to date.

    • addPost

      public void addPost(Post p)
      Adds a post to the list of posts that the account has made.
      Parameters:
      p - The post to be added to the list of posts that the account has made.

    • removePost

      public void removePost(Post p)
      Removes the post (specified by parameter p) from the list of posts that the account has made.
      Parameters:
      p - The post to be removed from the list of posts that the account has made.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string that contains information about an account including its unique account ID, the handle of the account, the description of the account, the number of posts the account has created (original posts, comments and endorsements) and the number of endorsement posts that refer to a post created by this account 
       ID: 1
 Handle: user1
 Description: This is my description
 Post count: 1
 Endorse count: 1
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • validateHandle

      public static void validateHandle(String handle, ArrayList<Account> accountList) throws InvalidHandleException, IllegalHandleException
      Validates a string to be used as the handle of an account by checking that it is less than 30 characters, not empty, contains no white space and is not being used by any other account in the system.
      Parameters:
      handle - The string to be used as the handle of an account.
      accountList - An ArrayList of account objects.
      Throws:
      InvalidHandleException - This is thrown when the handle is more than 30 characters, or is an empty string, or contains any whitespace.
      IllegalHandleException - This is thrown when an account already contains the handle defined in the parameter handle.

    • findAccountByHandle

      public static Account findAccountByHandle(String handle, ArrayList<Account> accounts) throws HandleNotRecognisedException
      Returns the account with the handle defined by parameter handle if it exists in the ArrayList accounts, otherwise a HandleNotRecognisedException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      handle - The account with the handle to find.
      accounts - An ArrayList of Account objects.
      Returns:
      The account object that has the handle that is equal to the parameter handle.
      Throws:
      HandleNotRecognisedException - This is thrown if no account has a handle defined by the parameter handle in the ArrayList of accounts (parameter accounts).

    • findAccountById

      public static Account findAccountById(int id, ArrayList<Account> accounts) throws AccountIDNotRecognisedException
      Returns the account with the ID defined by the parameter id if it contained in the ArrayList of accounts, otherwise an AccountIDNotRecognisedException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the account to find.
      accounts - An ArrayList of Accounts.
      Returns:
      The account with the ID that is equal to the parameter id.
      Throws:
      AccountIDNotRecognisedException - This is thrown if no account in the ArrayList of accounts that has an ID that is equal to the parameter id.
